column5: Occurs in: V + 곤 하다 and V + 곤 했다 talk about habits of the present and past respectively
turns an adjective into an adverb (https://www.koreanwikiproject.com/wiki/A_+_게), "so that": https://www.howtostudykorean.com/unit-3-intermediate-korean-grammar/unit-3-lessons-51-58/lesson-56/

clause connector (https://www.howtostudykorean.com/unit-3-intermediate-korean-grammar/lessons-67-75/lesson-70/). also table in https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%EC%9E%88%EB%8B%A4#Conjugation Cause/Reason marker
https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/라 lists various such suffixes: Imperative; that sb should; that; because
cause/reason connective form, formal polite (table in https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%EC%9E%88%EB%8B%A4#Conjugation)

interrogative formal polite (table in https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%EC%9E%88%EB%8B%A4#Conjugation). Actually composed of seumni-kka where seumni marks Formal Polite (compare -seumnida for indicative Formal Polite)

column1: # Nouns (should be irrelevant for the project)
